text:
Beyond all of the great comments above, I wanted to go somewhere that had these elements: good work/life balance (coming from an agency, I needed to reset my life), competitive pay, stable business, strong R&D, culture of empowerment.

When I interviewed around, I found several in-house marketing teams wanted former agency people. In the words of one hiring manager (who became my actual manager): “agency people know how to get shit done!” She and I bonded over working for the same holding company.

I pitched my experience as having a thick skin, being a quick learner, not being afraid to take creative risks, and being ultra collaborative.

text: Very relevant. I started off as a writer, then moved into senior management role ... now i am back to writing and editing. At times the people management part killed my energy and creativity just went through the window! I like taking ownership of my own tasks and leading that like a pro. But micromanaging people means compromising on creativity. What you are going through right now ... well you are not alone. :)
